segments.text: How can that woman not hear the water gushing out?
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She's drying that stupid plate like nothing's wrong.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The sink's a disaster, flooding the whole floor.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: And those kids, sneaking cookies like little thieves.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy's on that stool, probably going to break his neck.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Why can't they just ask nicely instead of this nonsense?
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl's egging him on, hand out like it's her right.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This kitchen's going to be ruined with all that water.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can't believe no one's noticing the dangers here.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The garden outside is calm, but in here it's infuriating.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Someone ought to yell and stop this before it's too late.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Drying dishes while the place floodsâ€”unacceptable.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Those cookies aren't worth the risk, kids.
segments.speaker: PAR
